examples.title: Arun's text
examples.original_text: The <nf>Haneto costume</nf> worn at Aomori's <nf>Nebuta Matsuri</nf> is one of Japan's most recognizable <sf>festival outfits</sf>. It is the <sf>traditional clothing</sf> for dancers in the Aomori festival and includes a white <nf>yukata</nf> with blue patterns, a triangular straw hat decorated with flowers called a <nf>hanagasa</nf>, a yellow waistband, and a sash called a <nf>tasuki</nf>. Dancers also wear <nf>tabi socks</nf> and <nf>zōri sandals</nf>, and they may attach small bells to their costume. <sf>Japanese festivals</sf> often feature popular foods such as <sf>sushi</sf>, <sf>ramen</sf>, and <sf>takoyaki</sf> that are now popular worldwide. Aomori, where Nebuta Matsuri takes place, is also known for its <sf>natural landscapes</sf> and <sf>coastal views</sf>, making it a well-known travel destination in Japan.
examples.gentle_rewrite: The <u>traditional festival dancer outfit</u> worn at Aomori’s <u>Nebuta Matsuri, a famous festival in northern Japan</u>, is one of Japan’s most recognizable <u>festival outfits</u>. It is the <u>traditional clothing</u> for dancers and includes a white <u>light cotton robe worn in summer (yukata)</u> with blue patterns, a <u>flower-decorated straw hat (hanagasa)</u>, a yellow waistband, and a <u>cloth band used to tie sleeves (tasuki)</u>. Dancers also wear <u>split-toe socks (tabi)</u> and <u>flat traditional sandals (zōri)</u>, and they may attach small bells to their costume. <u>Cultural celebrations in Japan</u> often feature popular foods such as <u>rice rolls with fish or vegetables (sushi)</u>, <u>noodle soup (ramen)</u>, and <u>fried snack balls (takoyaki)</u> that are now popular worldwide. Aomori, where Nebuta Matsuri takes place, is also known for <u>mountains, forests, and open nature</u>, as well as <u>views of the sea and beaches</u>, making it a well-known travel destination in Japan.
examples.full_rewrite: <u>During a major cultural celebration in northern Japan called Nebuta Matsuri</u>, dancers wear a <u>special traditional outfit</u> that is widely recognized across the country. This outfit includes a <u>light cotton robe similar to a simple kurta (yukata)</u>, a <u>flower-decorated straw hat</u>, a yellow belt, and a <u>cloth band used to tie up sleeves so dancers can move freely</u>. The dancers also wear <u>split-toe socks and flat sandals, similar to basic chappals</u>, and sometimes add <u>small bells that make sound while dancing</u>. Like <u>Indian festivals with street food</u>, Japanese festivals offer <u>well-known dishes</u> such as <u>rice rolls (sushi)</u>, <u>noodle soup (ramen)</u>, and <u>fried snack balls similar to paniyaram (takoyaki)</u>. The region of Aomori is also famous for its <u>mountains, forests, and seaside areas</u>, which makes it a <u>popular place for tourists visiting Japan</u>.

tagged_phrases.explanation: A specific Japanese name; describing its function makes it clearer.
Festival names are unfamiliar without location or context.
tagged_phrases.simpler: a famous festival in northern Japan

tagged_phrases.explanation: Traditional clothing term; needs description (similar to a simple kurta worn at home).
tagged_phrases.simpler: light cotton robe worn in summer

tagged_phrases.explanation: The Japanese name hides the actual meaning.
Very specific accessory; function-based explanation helps.
tagged_phrases.simpler: cloth band used to tie sleeves

tagged_phrases.explanation: Uncommon clothing item outside Japan.
Can be related to simple Indian chappals.
Clarifies purpose for general readers.
Makes the idea more concrete.

examples.title: Maria's text
examples.original_text: <sf>South Indian breakfasts</sf> are a <sf>celebration of comfort and flavour</sf>. The iconic <nf>masala dosa</nf>, golden and crispy, is a must-try—best enjoyed <sf>piping hot</sf> with a strong cup of tea, an <sf>unbeatable combination</sf> for any food lover. The accompanying <nf>chutney</nf> is <sf>spot on</sf>: spicy, fresh, and <sf>bursting with flavour</sf>, elevating every bite of the dosa. Equally popular is <nf>filter coffee</nf>, famous for its <sf>rich aroma and bold taste</sf>, making mornings instantly better. For those who prefer softer textures, <nf>idly</nf> is a <sf>wholesome and healthy choice</sf>, often praised as one of the lightest breakfasts. Steamed to perfection, it pairs beautifully with <nf>red and green chutneys</nf>. Don't miss the <sf>indulgent</sf> <nf>Mangalore bun</nf> either—slightly sweet, fluffy, and perfect with chutney. Served very hot, these South Indian classics offer a <sf>satisfying and memorable breakfast experience</sf>.
examples.gentle_rewrite: South Indian breakfasts are known for being <u>very tasty and comforting</u>. The famous <u>masala dosa, a thin Indian crepe filled with spiced potatoes</u>, is golden and crispy. It tastes best when served <u>very hot and fresh</u>, along with a <u>strong cup of tea</u>, which makes a great food pairing. The side sauce, called <u>chutney (a spicy Indian sauce)</u>, is fresh and spicy and adds a lot of flavour to each bite. Another popular drink is <u>filter coffee, a traditional Indian coffee</u>, known for its strong smell and bold taste. If you like soft foods, <u>idly, soft steamed rice cakes</u>, are a healthy and light option. They are steamed until soft and eaten with <u>red and green spicy sauces</u>. You can also try <u>Mangalore bun, a soft and slightly sweet fried bread</u>, which tastes best when served very hot. Together, these dishes make a <u>filling and enjoyable breakfast</u>.
examples.full_rewrite: South Indian breakfast foods are <u>warm, comforting, and full of flavour</u>. One of the most popular dishes is <u>masala dosa, a thin Indian crepe filled with gently spiced mashed potatoes</u>. It is crispy on the outside and soft inside. People enjoy it best when it is <u>served very hot</u>, often with <u>a strong cup of tea</u>. Dosa is eaten with <u>chutney, a spicy Indian dipping sauce</u>. The chutney is fresh and adds strong flavour to every bite. Many people also drink <u>filter coffee, a traditional Indian coffee made using a metal filter</u>, which has a deep smell and strong taste. If you prefer soft and light foods, <u>idly are a great choice</u>. <u>Idly are soft, steamed rice cakes</u> that are easy to eat and gentle on the stomach. They are usually served with <u>red and green spicy sauces</u>. Another popular item is <u>Mangalore bun</u>, which is <u>a fluffy, slightly sweet fried bread</u>. It feels rich and filling and is best eaten hot. These foods together create <u>a simple, filling, and enjoyable breakfast</u> that many people love.

tagged_phrases.explanation: User may know India

examples.title: Sruti's text
examples.original_text: This café instantly <sf>felt cozy</sf>, with a <sf>warm ambience</sf> and the <nf>comforting aroma of freshly ground coffee</nf> filling the space. Sitting inside was especially inviting, making it a perfect spot to slow down and enjoy the moment. I tried their signature Cinnamon Latte, which had a <sf>rich, smooth flavor</sf> with a <sf>delightful hint of cinnamon</sf> that elevated the entire experience. <nf>The aroma alone was irresistible</nf>. I also picked up their special candle, and it now <nf>fills my home with a soothing, calming scent</nf>. Overall, this place offers more than just great coffee—it's an experience. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for comfort, flavor, and a touch of warmth.
examples.gentle_rewrite: This café instantly felt cozy, with <u>soft lighting and warm interior colors creating a relaxing space</u>. Sitting inside was especially inviting, making it a perfect spot to slow down and enjoy the moment. I tried their signature Cinnamon Latte, which had a <u>full-bodied, well-balanced taste with a noticeable cinnamon flavor</u> that elevated the experience. <u>The drink stood out for its comforting and familiar flavor.</u> I also picked up their special candle, and it <u>creates a cozy atmosphere at home with its soft glow and calming presence</u>. Overall, this place offers more than just great coffee—it’s an experience. I’d definitely recommend it.
examples.full_rewrite: This café feels welcoming through its <u>soft lighting, warm colors, and calm indoor setting</u>, making it an easy place to relax and spend time. Sitting inside feels comfortable and unhurried. I tried their signature Cinnamon Latte, which is <u>full-bodied and pleasantly balanced, with a clear cinnamon flavor that many regulars enjoy</u>. It’s a drink that feels <u>familiar and satisfying rather than overwhelming</u>. I also bought their special candle, which <u>adds to the atmosphere at home with gentle light and a calming presence</u>. Overall, the café focuses on <u>comfort, thoughtful details, and quality</u>. I would strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a <u>relaxed and enjoyable café experience</u>.

tagged_phrases.phrase: comforting aroma of freshly ground coffee
tagged_phrases.explanation: Smell-based description is inaccessible; replaced with sound and environment cues.
tagged_phrases.simpler: the sound of coffee being prepared and the calm atmosphere inside

tagged_phrases.explanation: Explains appeal without relying on smell.
tagged_phrases.simpler: the drink stood out because of its balanced and comforting taste

tagged_phrases.phrase: fills my home with a soothing, calming scent
tagged_phrases.explanation: Shifts from scent to visual and emotional cues.
tagged_phrases.simpler: creates a cozy atmosphere with its soft glow and calming presence

tagged_phrases.explanation: Makes ambience concrete and visually clear.
tagged_phrases.simpler: soft lighting and warm interior colors

tagged_phrases.explanation: Clarifies the feeling without sensory assumptions.
tagged_phrases.simpler: felt relaxing and comfortable to spend time in

tagged_phrases.explanation: Simplifies taste description into familiar terms.
Grounded in taste rather than smell.
tagged_phrases.simpler: a noticeable cinnamon flavor that adds warmth to the drink

examples.title: George's text
examples.original_text: <sf>Leaves rustled in the evening breeze</sf>, <nf>a dry whisper like secrets the day was done confessing</nf>. Inside the hall, <sf>his voice thundered across the room</sf>, <nf>not loud so much as inevitable</nf>, <nf>a storm that demanded everyone stand still and listen</nf>. Later, when <nf>the house exhaled into quiet</nf>, <sf>raindrops drummed against the window</sf>, steady and patient, <nf>counting time the way a heart counts hope</nf>. <sf>The alarm blared at dawn</sf>, a rude insistence that <nf>dreams were no longer valid currency</nf>. Outside, <sf>the crowd roared in approval</sf> <nf>as if joy itself had found lungs</nf>. In the kitchen, the kettle whistled on the stove, <nf>sharp and pleading</nf>, while <sf>the phone chimed cheerfully</sf>, <nf>pretending urgency could be friendly</nf>. By nightfall, <sf>the wind howled through the dark streets</sf>, <nf>a feral choir circling the walls</nf>, reminding him that <nf>sound was never just noise</nf>. It was warning, comfort, memory, and proof that the world was still awake, even when he wanted to be anything but.
examples.gentle_rewrite: Leaves <u>moved gently</u> in the evening breeze, <u>creating a quiet feeling as the day ended</u>. Inside the hall, <u>he spoke with great force and authority</u>, <u>making it impossible to ignore</u>, <u>and everyone paid attention</u>. Later, when the house <u>became calm and still</u>, <u>raindrops hit steadily against the window</u>, <u>as time passed slowly and thoughtfully</u>. <u>The alarm signaled the start of the day</u>, a rude reminder that dreams were over. Outside, <u>the crowd showed great enthusiasm and excitement</u>, <u>as if happiness was clearly visible</u>. In the kitchen, <u>the kettle signaled it was ready</u>, <u>strongly demanding attention</u>, while <u>the phone gave a clear signal for attention</u>, <u>trying to seem important but polite</u>. By nightfall, <u>the wind blew strongly through the dark streets</u>, <u>moving wildly around the buildings</u>, reminding him that <u>events were never meaningless</u>. <u>They could show danger, safety, or memories</u>, and <u>life continued around him</u>, even when he wanted to rest.
examples.full_rewrite: In the evening, <u>the leaves moved gently in the breeze</u>, showing that the day was ending. Inside the hall, <u>the man spoke with strong authority</u>, and <u>everyone focused on him immediately</u>. Later, <u>the house became quiet and calm</u>, and <u>raindrops hit the window at a steady pace</u>, marking the slow passing of time. At dawn, <u>the alarm showed it was time to wake up</u>, ending his dreams. Outside, <u>a large group of people showed excitement and approval through their actions</u>. In the kitchen, <u>the kettle showed it was ready</u>, while <u>the phone gave a clear alert that needed attention</u>. At night, <u>strong wind moved through the empty streets</u>, <u>surrounding the buildings</u>. It reminded him that <u>what happens around us always has meaning</u>. <u>These moments can warn us, comfort us, or remind us of the past</u>, and <u>the world keeps going</u>, even when he feels tired and wants everything to stop.
